description: Guest User access and small improvements to the public API

features.text: Organizations can now add guest users to their organizations. Guest users must be classified as university guests, all links created by guests will be owned by the organization they are apart of.
Link analytics now supports filtering by QR Code traffic source

improvements.text: Update response payload for create link endpoint to include the newly generated link
Add option to return an existing link for the same long URL when creating a new link
CSV generation moved to server side for better performance on large links.

fixes.text: Fix bug to parse mid and uid correctly
Fix calculation of top most referrer
Resolve infinite loading issue in visit graph for links with high visit counts
Revert broken code from the dashboard preventing users from searching links

description: A small patch to fix some bugs from the last release.

features.text: Add quick access to stats of a link by appending /manage to it

improvements.text: Allow users to select a custom date range in the visits graph
Show comments and time blocked for links

fixes.text: Re-add ability to edit alias and long url of a shortened link
Show BlockedLinked and Blacklisted state in user view instead of a blank

description: The new public API for faculty developers, real-time notifications, continued codebase cleanup, testing suite update and organization page updates.

features.text: Add Super Access Tokens for the public API, managabale via admin dashboard
Alert system replaced with a new MOTD system
Backend tests are able to be run locally on the developer's machine with hot reloading using Docker
New page for creating tokens for the public API via organization management
Organizations can use our public API to interact with users, links, tracking pixels, and organizations
New page containing an API Reference for the public API
New pages in an organization's dashboard: Overview and Links allows organizations to quickly view and manage their links and tracking pixels
Organizations can now own a link or tracking pixel

improvements.text: Allow spaces in organization names with automatic cleanup
Warning popup appears before deleting an organization that has associated URLs
Feature flags are stored using React context hooks
Utilize environment variables over using a Python file for configuration values so feature flags can be changed at runtime
All API routes from the frontend to the backend are under a single directory
No longer able to clear visit data via the frontend to prevent accidental purges
Move to Lucide's Icon Framework from Ant Design's Icon Framework for more icon options
Filter settings now persist between login sessions
All links no longer support multiple aliases, links that had multiple aliases have been sharded into having only one
Creating a link now does not require calling two routes
Remove route to search links by their exact title value (this route was only used during testing)
Page dedicated for links and tracking pixels readjusted for new charts
Code quality checks are now the last stage of the CI/CD pipeline
Private API routes are now under "core" instead of "v1"
Individual organization management page now has a more consistent layout with the rest of the site
Three version of release notes, the web app, the public API, and the Outlook add-in
Table fonts are now 14px instead of 16px

fixes.text: Resolves incorrect link card URL/clipboard behavior for tracking pixel links; hides long URL
Fix organization creation showing false success messages when validation fails
Deleted organizations are removed from viewers/editors list in assoicated URL's
403 page no longer flickers before loading the actual page
404 page is returned when attempting to fetch an unavailable link
Creating a new link with an alias that was previously deleted no longer resurrects old data associated with the previously deleted link
Fix rare edgecase where creating a shortened link does not create an alias
Add a couple missing test cases regarding link creation
Phishing links can no longer be bypassed via API routes initially used for testing
Fix server crash when querying users on admin dashboard.

improvements.text: Add back the card-based design for the dashboard

fixes.text: Check for duplicate case-sensitive aliases in the frontend before submitting
When mis-capitalizing an alias that already exists, it no longer redirects to a 404
Add back multiple alias support for qr codes

improvements.text: Remove date picker for administration statistics
Remove repetitive words in the admin dashboard
User lookup renamed to user search with a slight redesign
Add button to copy original URL to clipboard
Replace mock dashboard with feature cards for the landing page

fixes.text: Add a maximum width to the original URL column in the dashboard table to prevent overflow errors
Fix styling for the developer environment warning banner and add link to the main site

description: A few patches based on the feedback from the last release.

improvements.text: Font has been made smaller on tables to fit more text

fixes.text: Regression from 3.0.0; the file name for qr codes will be the name of the alias
Regression from 3.0.0; "share" button has been replaced with the "qr code" button
Regression from 3.0.0; columns are no longer fixed on the left and right of the dashboard's table to avoid overflow errors
Delete button is disabled for deleted links

features.text: Links and tracking pixels have their own page dedicated for editing, collaborating, sharing, and viewing stats
New page for release notes
URI parameters being preserved from redirect
Add QR code generator via an exposed API endpoint

improvements.text: HTTPD handles routing instead of Flask
Dashboard displays links in a table
New admin dashboard with all pages condensed into one with tab
New collaborating UI
New profile dropdown menu
Add filter options for owner and link type (links and tracking pixels)
Add 403 and 404 pages with consistent styling with the rest of the website
HTTPD conditionally serves frontend and backend at the root
Changed to a new font "Geist"
Icons are now consistent throughout the site by using one icon framework instead of two
Tracking pixels are now served as an API route
Utilizing TailwindCSS 3 over SCSS
No longer using HashRouter, using BrowserRouter
Use breadcrumbs instead of a back button
Ban the future creation of case-sensitive aliases
Add GitLab CI/CD for Python and TypeScript code
Drop Internet Explorer support
Add a banner warning to users who are on the developer environment version of the site

fixes.text: Setting expiration time after creation no longer leads to invalid dates
Deleting a link with multiple aliases no longer only deletes its first alias
Organizations can no longer exist without any admins
Support iCloud Private Relay on Safari
Google Safe Browsing no longer shows a broken status message
Editors are no longer allowed to add owners as an editor or viewer

features.text: Implement tracking pixel functionality
Add user lookup to the admin dashboard
Microsoft Outlook Add-in created for uploading tracking pixels

improvements.text: Symbolic links are no longer needed in the building and deploying process
Dockerized entire codebase
Reworked the search functionality by using MongoDB's aggregate pipeline
Delete unnecessary HTML documentation generator for the frontend and backend
Add a 60 character limit to organization names
Update to the new Rutgers University logo

features.text: Google Safe Browsing integrated to prevent malicious websites from being added to the site

improvements.text: Made both dropdowns styles consistent with the dashboard
Admins of Shrunk can change easily change ownership of links
Admins of Shrunk can change edit any link without permission from its owner

fixes.text: Landing page footer styles fixed

features.text: Add a FAQ
Admins of its organization can change their organization's name

improvements.text: Add references to other Rutgers sites to the footer
Add back buttons to subpages
Power users can now have comments when granted the role
Admins of its organization can change their organization's name
Add remove button for users of an organization to add a member
